confessions.hook: I live in a different time zone now,
confessions.confession: where 3 AM medication calls and emergency room visits set the schedule instead of normal life.
confessions.validation: Caregiver time operates by different rules. Your world runs on love's clock.

confessions.confession: who can advocate fiercely in medical meetings while my heart is quietly breaking.
confessions.validation: Fierce advocacy with a broken heart is the ultimate act of love.

confessions.hook: I'm terrified that when this is over,
confessions.confession: I'll realize I forgot to take care of my own life while I was so busy saving theirs.
confessions.validation: This fear motivates balance. It's not too late to tend to your own garden.

confessions.confession: with doctors using clinical terminology while a part of me screams silently inside.
confessions.validation: Internal screaming while external functioning is advanced survival. You're protecting yourself.

confessions.hook: To the caregiver who just screamed into a pillow:
confessions.confession: your rage has nowhere else to go, and that's okay. Pillows don't judge.
confessions.validation: Pillow screaming is therapeutic. Let it out however you need to.

confessions.confession: that love matters more than suffering, that this choice to care will echo through generations.
confessions.validation: Love leaves marks on the universe. Your caregiving plants seeds in soil you'll never see grow.
